channel.title: The Mentalist
channel.description:
The Mentalist is a TV show based upon a character called Patrick Jane.
Patrick Jane is a CBI agent who solves crimes by being a "Mentalist", which is someone that uses mental acuity, hypnosis or suggestion. This appears to be physic however he just uses normal every day situations to manipulate people into telling the truth or helping find the truth. He gained this experience from previously being a TV Psychic.
His wife and child were brutally murdered after on his TV show announced that he was psychically homing in on a serial killer called Red John, this angered the serial killer leading to the death of Patricks family.
Its a quite enjoyable show with several layers, it is definitely worth a watch. It can get quite repetitive so I wouldn't suggest watching more than 2-3 episodes in a row.

item.title: The Mentalist
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I don’t think you understand hypnotism, it isn’t some mind controlling state that makes people 100% under your control to do things. It’s hit and miss, but has been found to be extremely effective when television cameras are present as people feel urged to comply and go along with the show. It’s also used therapeutically in 1-1 sessions, it may not work with you or me, but if people want something to work it generally does as it just allows them to focus their concentration. There’s no mind controlling state, that’s just the showmanship dressing it up.

Hypnotizing someone and all that bull crap are just lies.
Magic and misdirection are based on lies, doesn't mean its bullshit and it certainly doesn't mean hypnotism doesn't exist. Unless you have some compelling evidence to the contrary.
